technical.focal_length: 24-85mm most common, wide angles (14-35mm) for environmental context, 50-135mm for portraits, telephoto (70-200mm) for sports/events
technical.depth_of_field: Variable based on story needs - shallow f/1.4-f/2.8 for subject isolation, deep f/5.6-f/11 for environmental context and multiple subjects
technical.shutter_speed: 1/60s-1/250s for portraits and interviews, 1/500s+ for action/events, sometimes slower for intentional motion blur storytelling
technical.lighting: Natural light preferred when possible, minimal flash intervention, bounce flash or LED panels for indoor work, maintaining authentic atmosphere over perfect lighting
technical.camera_format: Full-frame DSLR/mirrorless dominant, medium format for high-end magazines, occasionally 35mm film for specific aesthetic

aesthetic.composition: Rule of thirds, leading lines, strong geometric elements, asymmetrical balance, negative space to accommodate text layout, multiple focal points
aesthetic.subject_background: Background provides context and story information, environmental elements support narrative, minimal backgrounds only when subject is the complete story
aesthetic.tonal_range: Full tonal range preserved, moderate contrast, shadow detail retention important, highlights controlled to avoid blown areas
aesthetic.color_approach: Natural color palette reflecting real environment, muted tones common, color grading subtle and story-appropriate, black and white for timeless or serious subjects
aesthetic.texture_detail: High detail retention throughout frame, textures support storytelling, fabric, architectural, and skin textures rendered naturally

shooting_approach.subject_distance: Varies widely - close portraits (3-6 feet), environmental shots (10-30 feet), establishing shots (50+ feet), dictated by story requirements
shooting_approach.angle_perspective: Eye level most common, slight variations for visual interest, low angles for empowerment themes, high angles for vulnerability, Dutch angles rare
shooting_approach.subject_relationship: Mix of posed and candid moments, subjects aware of camera but natural, authentic expressions prioritized over perfect poses
shooting_approach.environment: On-location shooting dominant, subjects in their natural or relevant environments, studio only when environmental context unnecessary

context.historical_context: Emerged with photojournalism in 1930s-40s, evolved with magazine culture post-WWII, influenced by Life Magazine and European photo essays
context.key_characteristics: Story-driven imagery, authentic moments, environmental context, technical excellence, ethical representation, layout consideration

era_variants.notes: 1950s-60s emphasized formal poses and studio work, 1970s-80s became more environmental and candid, 1990s-2000s increased color saturation and stylization, 2010s+ embraced authentic moments and diverse representation
